article.headline: Pennsylvania 68, Drexel 49
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Ibrahim Jaaber scored 22 points and Mark Zoller added 16 points and 10 rebounds to lead Penn past Drexel 68-49 on Tuesday. Steve Danley scored 14 points while Brian Grandieri had 12 points, nine rebounds and eight assists for the Quakers (3-2), who won their third straight. Dominick Mejia led the Dragons (2-1) with 10 points, but was held scoreless in the second half. Drexel never led in the game and trailed by as many as 13 points in the first half before rallying. Penn led 31-26 at halftime. With 11:46 remaining in the second half, the Dragons got within 40-33 on a basket by Scott Rodgers. But the Quakers pulled away with a 12-3 run -- five points by Zoller, four by Jaaber and three by Grandieri -- for a 52-36 lead with 7:08 left. Penn shot 48 percent from the field and hit 16-of-19 free throws. Drexel, meanwhile, struggled with its shooting, hitting 17-of-51 shots (33 percent), including just 5-of-20 from 3-point territory. The Dragons also committed 19 turnovers, eight by Frank Elegar.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
